title: How to write a formal thank you letter - Quora

response.answer_text: Thank you letters are meant to make the receiver feel good about something that they have done for you or given you. If you keep this in mind, then you will be set. Start by stating what you are thankful for. “Thank you for the gift/time/consideration…” Then follow up with stating why the gift of time/physical object was meaningful to you, and then explain why you felt that way. Did it help you achieve a goal? Was it something that you’ve been really wanting but couldn’t afford? Did the time that was given to you provide some insight/wisdom/direction for you life? The key is to be sincere. The recipient will know if they are getting a form letter sent out of obligation.

Please check for previous ‘how do I write a letter’ answers rather than simply posting such a question as if you were the only person in the world to have a problem performing a simple task. A letter is a letter. State your purpose, then close. How hard is that?
